pullRequest.title: Use OpenAPI examples to generate Values in Requests on behalf of SDA SE
pullRequest.bodyText:
Using Example values from the imported API Definition for Request values.
Closes zaproxy/zaproxy#5168
Changes made on behalf of SDA SE
Notes
OpenAPI 2 didn't support examples in the path or query sections of requests. The in official fallback was to use a property called x-example or x-examples to specify multiple examples. The x-example properties are also supported by this change, as the automatic OpenAPI 2 => 3 conversion upgrades these to the official OpenAPI 3 example property automatically.
Limitations
This implementation currently only supports examples using the single value example property not the examples property. The examples object is basically a map of named examples where the key is the name. See: https://swagger.io/docs/specification/adding-examples/
I guess the best thing to do here would probably be to pick the first alphabetically first key in the examples object. To keep it predictable which one Zap will pick.
Open Todos

 Support Example values in Request Bodies
 Add test for Request Path Value
 Add test for Request Query Parameter Value
 Add test for Value in Request Body
 Support for examples property. Should probably pick the first example.
 Add test for example using multiple examples

nodes.bodyText: This should be done before instantiating the above StringBuilder.
The exception (at least the message) should be included.
This seems unnecessary, the getter can be called directly like in BodyGenerator.
I'd suggest reverting this, it avoids generating a value when not needed (header parameters).
Better remove the example fields than change the tests, these should not test the example logic.

commit.message: Use OpenAPI 3 example in URL Path & Query
Duplicate PetStore OpenAPI Spec to add example to
Add example values to OpenAPI Spec

Add test to check behaviour of crawler for OpenAPI Specs using examples

This test is a bit different to the others in the test file,
as these use the same assertion helper function which asserts
that **ALL** the urls are right.
This doesn't really work here as the point of the test is that
the urls are supposed to be different.
Use example from object schema as values
Update PetStore test which contains an example property
Use example value in complex form data string
Add expected response for OpenAPI v2 Test
Update Expected Response in Abstract Test Class
Add test case for examples in arrays
Allow to specify full examples for arrays
Update comments in Example OpenAPI Specs
Remove unnecessary StringBuilder
Include exception in warning log
Inline get and has example methods
Move value generation one level lower
Remove example from general OpenAPI tests
Add for OpenAPI 2.0 using x-example attributes
Clarify method name
Remove forgotten debug log
Add note to changelog
Remove redundant part from test name
Add SDA SE to OpenAPI Extension Author List

beforeCommit.message: Remove redundant part from test name

afterCommit.message: Add SDA SE to OpenAPI Extension Author List
